result.execSummary:
The defendant Dangelo Domonique Troupe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 
4 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.

miscConds.notes: Court ordered restitution in the amount of $1000.00 to be paid to Hertz rental car.

Defendant ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge in this case as it pre-dates the April 1, 2015 change in law.
Pay all costs and surcharges by the end of probation,  if revoked, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Seek and maintain full time employment.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Absolute Sobriety.
Random urine screens.  No positive results.

records.addlTxt:
AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.   

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year with the following conditions:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute Sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

-Court ordered restitution in the amount of $1000.00 to be paid to Hertz rental car.

- Defendant ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge in this case as it pre-dates the April 1, 2015 change in law.

- Pay all costs and surcharges by the end of probation,  if revoked, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
filed.  Count 1, Theft, contrary to sec. 943.20(1)(a) Wis. Stats.  a Class A misdemeanor.

Defendant Dangelo Domonique Troupe in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.
Defendant Dangelo Domonique Troupe in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dangelo Domonique Troupe in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  FILE NOT IN COURT.
  Plea hearing scheduled for 05-20-2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Dangelo Domonique Troupe in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requesting Court to cancel JusticePoint supervision. No objection from Defense. Court grant request.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Defendant Dangelo Domonique Troupe in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Ron Dague for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 2/13/15.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dangelo Domonique Troupe in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Dangelo Domonique Troupe in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
